name: Marvel Movies
description: Iconic lines from Marvel superhero films spanning the MCU, X-Men, Spider-Man, and more.
author: Quips Editorial

quotes.content: I am Iron Man.
quotes.notes: Final line of the first MCU film. Stark's press conference confession was improvised by Downey and changed superhero movie conventions.

quotes.content: With great power comes great responsibility.
quotes.notes: Originally from Amazing Fantasy #15 (1962). The Sam Raimi film made this the definitive Spider-Man motto.

quotes.content: I can do this all day.
quotes.notes: Steve's catchphrase, first said before his transformation. Becomes a running gag throughout the MCU, culminating in Endgame.

quotes.content: Wakanda forever!
quotes.notes: The Wakandan salute became a cultural phenomenon. Tragically gained new meaning after Boseman's death in 2020.

quotes.content: I am Groot.
quotes.notes: Groot's only words, with different meanings conveyed through inflection. Diesel recorded the line in multiple languages.

quotes.content: That's my secret, Captain. I'm always angry.
quotes.notes: Banner's revelation before transforming in the Battle of New York. Redefines the character's relationship with the Hulk.

quotes.content: Puny god.
quotes.notes: After smashing Loki repeatedly against the floor. One of the film's biggest crowd-pleasing moments.

quotes.content: I love you 3000.
quotes.notes: Based on something Downey's real children said to him. Tony repeats it in his recorded message, adding emotional weight.

quotes.content: Avengers, assemble.
quotes.notes: The iconic comics rallying cry, saved for 11 years until this climactic moment. Cap finally says the full phrase.

quotes.content: I am inevitable.
quotes.notes: Thanos' declaration before snapping, countered by Tony's 'I am Iron Man.' Bookends the Infinity Saga.

quotes.content: Dread it. Run from it. Destiny arrives all the same.
quotes.notes: Thanos' nihilistic philosophy. First spoken to Gamora; reflects his fatalistic worldview.

quotes.content: Perfectly balanced, as all things should be.
quotes.notes: Thanos explains his motivation while teaching young Gamora. Became a widely-used meme format.

quotes.content: I'm Mary Poppins, y'all!
quotes.notes: After Peter calls him Mary Poppins during a descent. Yondu's proud acceptance is both funny and touching.

quotes.content: We are Groot.
quotes.notes: Groot's sacrifice moment. The shift from 'I' to 'We' signifies his acceptance of the Guardians as family.

quotes.content: Higher, further, faster.
quotes.notes: Carol's Air Force motto with Maria Rambeau. Became the marketing tagline for the film.

quotes.content: I'm not looking for forgiveness, and I'm way past asking permission.
quotes.notes: Steve's declaration to Tony when choosing to protect Bucky. Defines his character's moral absolutism.

quotes.content: The hardest choices require the strongest wills.
quotes.notes: Thanos' justification for his genocidal plan. Spoken to Doctor Strange on Titan.

quotes.content: Whosoever holds this hammer, if he be worthy, shall possess the power of Thor.
quotes.notes: The enchantment Odin places on Mjolnir. Sets up the 'worthiness' theme that pays off in later films.

quotes.content: Another!
quotes.notes: Thor smashes his coffee mug demanding more. A comedic culture clash moment that became a meme.

quotes.content: I have been falling for thirty minutes!
quotes.notes: Loki's complaint after Doctor Strange's portal trick. Exemplifies Ragnarok's comedic tone.

quotes.content: The sun will shine on us again.
quotes.notes: Loki's final words to Thor before Thanos kills him. Shows his character growth and fraternal love.

quotes.content: I'm just a kid from Brooklyn.
quotes.notes: Steve's humble self-description to Dr. Erskine. Defines his character's everyman quality.

quotes.content: Part of the journey is the end.
quotes.notes: From Tony's recorded message. Foreshadows his sacrifice and provides closure for his character arc.

quotes.content: You get hurt, hurt 'em back. You get killed, walk it off.
quotes.notes: Cap's battle motivation to the team. Showcases his no-quit attitude with a touch of dark humor.

quotes.content: Just because someone stumbles and loses their path, doesn't mean they can't be saved.
quotes.notes: Charles' message about hope and redemption. Central to the X-Men's philosophy on mutant rehabilitation.

quotes.content: Mutation: it is the key to our evolution.
quotes.notes: Opening narration explaining mutants. Sets up the franchise's civil rights allegory.

quotes.content: I'm the best there is at what I do. But what I do best isn't very nice.
quotes.notes: Classic Wolverine line from the comics. First appeared in Wolverine #1 (1982) by Chris Claremont.

quotes.content: So this is what it feels like.
quotes.notes: Logan's final words, presumably about mortality. Jackman's emotional farewell to the character after 17 years.

quotes.content: Maximum effort!
quotes.notes: Wade's battle cry. Became Reynolds' signature phrase, used in marketing and sequels.

quotes.content: I'm touching myself tonight.
quotes.notes: Wade's response to meeting Colossus. Exemplifies the R-rated humor that defined the film.

quotes.content: You're about to be killed by a Zamboni!
quotes.notes: Wade's creative threat during the final battle. Shows Deadpool's absurdist approach to violence.

quotes.content: You didn't see that coming?
quotes.notes: Quicksilver's catchphrase, referencing his super-speed. His final use of it is tragically heroic.

quotes.content: Before we get started, does anyone want to get out?
quotes.notes: Cap alone in elevator full of HYDRA agents. The ensuing fight became one of the MCU's best action scenes.

quotes.content: I could do this all day. Yeah, I know.
quotes.notes: Cap fighting his 2012 self. The meta exchange pays off the running catchphrase.

quotes.content: We don't trade lives.
quotes.notes: Steve's moral stance on sacrificing Vision. Contrasts with his own willingness to sacrifice himself.

quotes.content: I had a date.
quotes.notes: Steve's last words before crashing into the ice. The promised dance with Peggy becomes a saga-long thread.

quotes.content: You want forgiveness? Get religion.
quotes.notes: Symbiote-influenced Peter. The line became a meme representing the film's darker Peter moments.

quotes.content: Pizza time!
quotes.notes: Peter's delivery job catchphrase. Became a viral meme decades after the film's release.

quotes.content: I'm gonna put some dirt in your eye.
quotes.notes: Symbiote Peter's taunt. One of the Raimi trilogy's most memed lines.

quotes.content: Mr. Stark, I don't feel so good.
quotes.notes: Peter's heartbreaking death scene. Holland improvised much of the emotional delivery; Tony's reaction devastated audiences.
